r.s: Provides an api to create a HTML tree
r.d: PHP Based api creates a tree structure using a couple of small PHP classes. This can then be converted to javascript using the printMenu() method. The tree is dynamic in IE 4 or higher and NN6/Mozilla, and maintains state (the collapsed/expanded status of the branches) by using cookies. Other browser display the tree fully expanded. Each node can have an optional link and icon. New API in 1.1 with many changes (see CVS for changelog) and new features, of which most came from Chip Chapin (http://www.chipchapin.com).
r.n: Added event support, and moved various options from the TreeMenu class to the presentation classes. Added presentation base class.
